remove rows or columns with missing values in a data.frame or matrix

Source: R/ctree.funs.r
rmNA.Rd

remove rows or columns with missing values in a data.frame or matrix

Usage

rmNA(df1, margins = 1, maxNA.perc = 0.95, minNonNA.count = 5)

Arguments

df1

data.frame or matrix

margins

an int vector of 1 and 2 for rows and columns; e.g. 2:1 means the removal order is column then row.

maxNA.perc, minNonNA.count

maximum %NA or minimum non-NA items allowed failure to match either leads to removal

Value

df1 after cleaning; data type is kept even if 0 or 1 row or column remains

Examples

# none
